  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Event Assistant",
  "description": "The HRHive - Our client, Atinudah is a boundary-pushing creative company rooted in storytelling, experience, and culture. Our events division - Atinudah Concepts, specializes in unforgettable experiential design, brand activations, and moments that move people. Whether it&rsquo;s a luxury brand launch, a cultural festival, or an intimate celebration, we bring strategy, story, and spectacle to life.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Event Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We&rsquo;re looking for a smart, organized, and execution-focused Event Assistant to join the Atinudah Concepts team. This role is essential to the success of every event, serving as a central operational link between teams, vendors, and timelines.
	You will work closely with Event Coordinators to implement all event logistics, manage on-ground execution, and ensure that every detail is executed to perfection, from set build to breakdown.
	You&rsquo;ll support everything from venue coordination, creative implementation, production tracking, and vendor alignment to ensuring day-of-event delivery standards are met across all touchpoints.
	You must be highly collaborative, calm under pressure, resourceful, and deeply committed to delivering top-tier experiences, no matter the event size or type.


Key Responsibilities
Logistics, Coordination &amp; Operational Support:


	Assist in managing all pre-event logistics, including venue walk-throughs, item checklists, load-in/load-out schedules, and vendor alignment.
	Coordinate with internal teams and external partners to ensure seamless material movement, branding installations, and overall site readiness.
	Track and manage delivery of production materials, printed items, branding components, and event collateral across locations.


Execution &amp; On-Ground Excellence:


	Oversee the setup, monitoring, and dismantling of event spaces in collaboration with the production and creative teams.
	Ensure brand quality, layout accuracy, and environmental aesthetics are consistent with creative direction.
	Actively monitor timelines, vendor activity, and guest experience touchpoints during live events, flagging potential issues and solving problems in real time.


Vendor Management &amp; Relationship Handling:


	Liaise directly with vendors and service providers to align expectations, timelines, and deliverables.
	Provide on-site oversight of vendor execution (e.g., lighting, AV, catering, technical teams) and maintain positive working relationships for future collaboration.
	Track vendor check-ins, ensure timely delivery of services, and assist in vendor feedback documentation.


Budget Documentation &amp; Support:


	Collaborate with event coordinators to manage expense documentation, vendor quotes, and cost-tracking spreadsheets.
	Support in sourcing cost-effective options for materials, rentals, and supplies, helping to optimize project budgets.
	Maintain post-event reports and ensure all documentation is organized and filed correctly.


Creative Implementation &amp; Brand Alignment:


	Work with concept and design teams to understand layout directions and ensure on-site creative materials are installed correctly (e.g., banners, backdrops, floorplans).
	Offer suggestions on-site when creative solutions are needed due to space, weather, or vendor limitations.
	Uphold brand integrity in every interaction, both visually and professionally.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degee with 1&ndash;3 years of experience in event support, coordination, production logistics, or project execution roles
	Experience working in cross-functional creative environments (events, activations, and brand launches).
	Excellent organizational and communication skills, written, verbal, and interpersonal.
	Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while staying focused and detail-oriented.
	Strong coordination and time management skills, you know how to &ldquo;hold time&rdquo; and get teams moving.
	Familiarity with inventory management, production workflows, or supply chain coordination, and tools like Google Sheets, Trello, Notion, or Monday.com for task tracking and reporting.
	A solution -driven mindset, you don&rsquo;t panic under pressure; you adapt and move forward.
	Professionalism and polish when interacting with vendors, clients, and brand partners.


Bonus If You Bring:


	A strong existing network of vendors, logistics providers, or venue managers
	Experience working with AV, technical teams, stage managers, or live show operators
	Familiarity with design platforms (Canva, Illustrator) for basic asset adjustments or mockups
	Strong visual sensibility and understanding of spatial aesthetics
	Experience working in luxury, tech, or lifestyle brand activation
	Passion for building seamless and extraordinary experiences for real people.


Salary
Attractive.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;thehrhive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Bonus If You Bring:


	A strong existing network of vendors, logistics providers, or venue managers
	Experience working with AV, technical teams, stage managers, or live show operators

	Strong visual sensibility and understanding of spatial aesthetics
	Experience working in luxury, tech, or lifestyle brand activation
	Passion for building seamless and extraordinary experiences for real people.


Salary
Attractive.

Head, Internal Audit & Compliance Job at Debmyk Consult




        
    

        
        Debmyk is Consulting firm which specialized in HR outsourced services such as recruitment, training and development, performance management, among others.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Internal Audit & Compliance

Job Location: Isolo, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Head of Internal Audit & Compliance will be responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes of the bank.
	The role ensures strict compliance with regulatory guidelines and internal policies while safeguarding the bank’s assets.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage the internal audit function of the bank.
	Develop and implement a comprehensive audit plan covering financial, operational, and regulatory compliance.
	Carry out regular audit reviews of operations and accounts to identify risks and recommend corrective actions.
	Ensure compliance with CBN regulations, industry standards, and internal control policies.
	Prepare timely and accurate audit reports for management and the Board.
	Provide advisory support on risk management and internal controls.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree / HND in Accounting (minimum).
	Minimum of 4 years of experience in auditing within a Microfinance Bank.
	Professional qualification such as CIBN, ICAN, or ACCA
	Strong knowledge of regulatory compliance requirements in the microfinance sector.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and leadership skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: osemengee@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
